title: Tick Board - Web Kanban for Ticks
description: A local web server that displays ticks in a kanban board interface with human interaction capabilities (approve, reject, add notes). Server looks for .tick in current dir or takes path as argument.
notes:
2026-01-16 10:25 - Completed qai (Core server with CLI). Key decisions: Used cobra for CLI (consistent with modern Go practices), embedded static files using go:embed, server uses context-based graceful shutdown. Static files in internal/tickboard/server/static/. Next tasks should add API endpoints to server.go and build out the frontend in static files.
2026-01-16 10:28 - Completed hsg (API: List ticks with filters). The GET /api/ticks endpoint is in server.go. Uses query package for loading/filtering ticks. Response includes computed isBlocked and column fields. Column constants are ColumnBacklog, ColumnReady, etc. TickResponse struct embeds tick.Tick. Next tasks can add more API endpoints following this pattern.
2026-01-16 10:31 - Completed vec (API: Approve tick). POST /api/ticks/:id/approve endpoint in server.go. Uses handleTickActions router that parses /api/ticks/:id/action paths. Response type is ApproveTickResponse with embedded tick.Tick plus isBlocked, column, closed fields. Endpoint validates awaiting state, handles legacy Manual flag. Next tasks can add more actions (reject, etc.) by extending the switch in handleTickActions.
2026-01-16 10:35 - Completed 0ss (API: Reject tick). POST /api/ticks/:id/reject endpoint added to server.go using handleTickActions router. Accepts JSON with feedback field, adds timestamped note with '(from: human)' prefix. Uses same pattern as approve endpoint. Important: ProcessVerdict clears verdict when tick doesn't close (per audit trail design), so rejected terminal states return to ready column, not rejected column. Response uses RejectTickResponse with computed isBlocked/column/closed fields.
2026-01-16 10:39 - Completed pan (Kanban board layout). Static HTML/CSS with 6 columns using Catppuccin Mocha palette. CSS uses variables for all colors. Column data-column attributes match server constants (backlog, ready, review, input, rejected, done). Empty state shows for each column. Tick card styles are defined but unused until dynamic loading is implemented. Task awaiting content review.
2026-01-16 10:44 - Completed sok (UI: Tick card component). Card component fully implemented in app.js createTickCard() with: ID badges colored by type (task=blue, epic=mauve, bug=red), truncated 2-line titles, priority badges (P0-P1=red, P2=peach, P3=green, P4=gray), status icons matching tk view (○/●/✓/◐/⊘), awaiting/requires/blocked badges. CSS styles in style.css lines 203-340. Click handler prepared for future detail panel task.
2026-01-16 10:46 - Completed ccz (API: Get single tick). GET /api/ticks/:id endpoint added to server.go using handleGetTick(). Response includes full tick plus: notesList (parsed array with timestamp/author/text), blockerDetails (ID/title/status for each blocker), isBlocked, column. parseNotes() parses timestamp format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM - (from: author) text'. Missing blockers get placeholder values. Next tasks can use this endpoint for tick detail views.
